JsonPath.HelpText: Marks the time at which the first text or image is painted.
Share of relative 'fast' First Contentful Paint
Share of relative 'average' First Contentful Paint
Share of relative 'slow' First Contentful Paint
Measures the time from when a user first interacts with your site.
Share of relative 'fast' First Input Delay
Share of relative 'average' First Input Delay
Share of relative 'slow' First Input Delay
Either AVERAGE, FAST, SLOW or NONE
First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted.

Share of relative 'average' Origin First Contentful Paint

Measures the time from when a user first interacts with your site.
Share of relative 'fast' Origin First Input Delay

Overall Score
Interactive marks the time at which the page is fully interactive.
Interactive marks the time at which the page is fully interactive.
First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted.
First Contentful Paint marks the time at which the first text or image is painted.
First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible.
First Meaningful Paint measures when the primary content of a page is visible.
Browser engineers recommend pages contain fewer than ~1,500 DOM nodes.
Browser engineers recommend pages contain fewer than ~1,500 DOM nodes.
Minifying JavaScript files can reduce payload sizes and script parse time.
Minifying CSS files can reduce network payload sizes.
Redirects introduce additional delays before the page can be loaded.
Large GIFs are inefficient for delivering animated content. Consider using MPEG4/WebM videos for animations and PNG/WebP for static images
Time To First Byte identifies the time at which your server sends a response.
Time To First Byte identifies the time at which your server sends a response.
Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times.
Large network payloads cost users real money and are highly correlated with long load times.
Evaluates all of the render-blocking links or scripts that it has detected.
Evaluates all of the render-blocking links or scripts that it has detected.
Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption.
Image formats like JPEG 2000, JPEG XR, and WebP often provide better compression than PNG or JPEG, which means faster downloads and less data consumption.
Consider using 'link rel=preload' to prioritize fetching resources that are currently requested later in page load.
Text-based resources should be served with compression (gzip, deflate or brotli) to minimize total network bytes.
Optimized images load faster and consume less cellular data.
A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page.
A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page.
A long cache lifetime can speed up repeat visits to your page.
Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time.
Serve images that are appropriately-sized to save cellular data and improve load time.
Consider adding preconnect or dns-prefetch resource hints to establish early connections to important third-party origins.
Estimated Input Latency
Estimated Input Latency
JavaScript execution time
JavaScript execution time
Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive.
Consider lazy-loading offscreen and hidden images after all critical resources have finished loading to lower time to interactive.
Remove unused rules from stylesheets to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity.
Remove unused rules from stylesheets to reduce unnecessary bytes consumed by network activity.
Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated.
Speed Index shows how quickly the contents of a page are visibly populated.
First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.
First CPU Idle marks the first time at which the page's main thread is quiet enough to handle input.
Leverage the font-display CSS feature to ensure text is user-visible while webfonts are loading.
Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS.
Consider reducing the time spent parsing, compiling and executing JS.
What resources are loaded with a high priority.
Image display dimensions should match natural aspect ratio.
Consider marking your touch and wheel event listeners as `passive` to improve your page's scroll performance
Application Cache is deprecated.
Preventing password pasting undermines good security policy.
Some third-party scripts may contain known security vulnerabilities that are easily identified and exploited by attackers.
Specifying a doctype prevents the browser from switching to quirks-mode
Errors logged to the console indicate unresolved problems.
For users on slow connections, external scripts dynamically injected via `document.write()` can delay page load by tens of seconds
front-end JavaScript libraries detected on the page
Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request their location without context.
Users are mistrustful of or confused by sites that request to send notifications without context.
All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data.
Link text (and alternate text for images, when used as links) that is discernible, unique, and focusable improves the navigation experience for screen reader users.
Screen reader users rely on frame titles to describe the contents of frames.
Disabling zooming is problematic for users with low vision who rely on screen magnification to properly see the contents of a web page.
The value of an id attribute must be unique to prevent other instances from being overlooked by assistive technologies.
If a page doesn't specify a lang attribute, a screen reader assumes that the page is in the default language that the user chose when setting up the screen reader.
The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search.
Low-contrast text is difficult or impossible for many users to read.
Adding ways to bypass repetitive content lets keyboard users navigate the page more efficiently.
Informative elements should aim for short, descriptive alternate text. Decorative elements can be ignored with an empty alt attribute.
Specifying a valid [BCP 47 language]
ARIA roles must have valid values in order to perform their intended accessibility functions.
Some ARIA roles have required attributes that describe the state of the element to screen readers.
Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid names.
Assistive technologies, like screen readers, can't interpret ARIA attributes with invalid values.
Some ARIA child roles must be contained by specific parent roles to properly perform their intended accessibility functions.
Some ARIA parent roles must contain specific child roles to perform their intended accessibility functions.
The service worker is the technology that enables your app to use many Progressive Web App features, such as offline, add to homescreen, and push notifications.
If you've already set up HTTPS, make sure that you redirect all HTTP traffic to HTTPS.
Browsers can proactively prompt users to add your app to their homescreen, which can lead to higher engagement.
A service worker enables your web app to be reliable in unpredictable network conditions.
A fast page load over a cellular network ensures a good mobile user experience.
All sites should be protected with HTTPS, even ones that don't handle sensitive data.
Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens.
If you're building a Progressive Web App, consider using a service worker so that your app can work offline.
Your app should display some content when JavaScript is disabled
A themed splash screen ensures a high-quality experience when users launch your app from their homescreens.
The browser address bar can be themed to match your site.
Descriptive link text helps search engines understand your content.
Pages with unsuccessful HTTP status codes may not be indexed properly.
Meta descriptions may be included in search results to concisely summarize page content.
Search engines can't index plugin content, and many devices restrict plugins or don't support them.
Add a viewport meta tag to optimize your app for mobile screens.
Canonical links suggest which URL to show in search results.
hreflang links tell search engines what version of a page they should list in search results for a given language or region.
Search engines are unable to include your pages in search results if they don't have permission to crawl them.
Font sizes less than 12px are too small to be legible and require mobile visitors to “pinch to zoom” in order to read.
The title gives screen reader users an overview of the page, and search engine users rely on it heavily to determine if a page is relevant to their search.
If your robots.txt file is malformed, crawlers may not be able to understand how you want your website to be crawled or indexed.
